charm_misc¶

Module defining some miscellaneous functions, macros, constants, etc.

Note

All functions that deal with numerics are written in double precision.

Defines

CHARM_MIN(a, b)¶

Returns the minimum of a and b.

CHARM_MAX(a, b)¶

Returns the maximum of a and b.

CHARM_VERSION_MAJOR¶

Major version number of CHarm.

CHARM_VERSION_MINOR¶

Minor version number of CHarm.

CHARM_VERSION_PATCH¶

Patch number of CHarm.

CHARM_VERSION¶

Version of CHarm.

Functions

void charm_misc_print_version(void)¶

Prints library info to stdout (library name, version, compilation date, precision, etc).

_Bool charm_misc_is_nearly_equal(double a, double b, double eps)¶

Judges whether two double numbers, a and b, are equal up to some threshold eps.

Example use:

if (charm_misc_is_nearly_equal(a, b, eps))
{
    // The two numbers are equal up to "eps"
}
else
{
    // The two numbers are not equal up to "eps"
}

Returns

Boolean 1 if the two double numbers are equal up to the threshold eps or 0 otherwise.

double charm_misc_arr_min(const double *a, size_t na, charm_err *err)¶
Parameters

  • a – [in] A double array.

  • na – [in] Length of a.

  • err – [out] Error reported by the function (if any).

Returns

The minimum value of a. In case of an error, returned is the nan value and the error is written to err.

double charm_misc_arr_max(const double *a, size_t na, charm_err *err)¶
Parameters

  • a – [in] A double array.

  • na – [in] Length of a.

  • err – [out] Error reported by the function (if any).

Returns

The maximum value of a. In case of an error, returned is the nan value and the error is written to err.

double charm_misc_arr_mean(const double *a, size_t na, charm_err *err)¶
Parameters

  • a – [in] A double array.

  • na – [in] Length of a.

  • err – [out] Error reported by the function (if any).

Returns

The mean value of a. In case of an error, returned is the nan value and the error is written to err.

double charm_misc_arr_std(const double *a, size_t na, charm_err *err)¶
Parameters

  • a – [in] A double array.

  • na – [in] Length of a.

  • err – [out] Error reported by the function (if any).

Returns

The standard devation of a normalized by the array size na. In case of an error, returned is the nan value and the error is written to err.

double charm_misc_arr_rms(const double *a, size_t na, charm_err *err)¶
Parameters

  • a – [in] A double array.

  • na – [in] Length of a.

  • err – [out] Error reported by the function (if any).

Returns

The root mean square of a. In case of an error, returned is the nan value and the error is written to err.

int charm_misc_arr_chck_lin_incr(const double *a, size_t na, size_t first, size_t every_nth, double eps, charm_err *err)¶

Checks whether elements of a double arr array of size meet the following conditions:

1) the first element of the array is smaller or equal to the smallest element from the elements that follow it,

2) the difference lat[i] - lat[i - every_nth] for i = first, first + every_nth, …, size - 1 is positive and constant (within some numerical threshold eps).

For instance, if first = 0 and every_nth = 1, the function checks whether all elements of arr are linearly increasing with a constant step. If every_nth = 2, the function does the same, but for every_nth element starting from first.

Error reported by the function (if any) is written to err.

Returns

0 if all conditions are met; otherwise, returned is the number of the condition that is not satisfied. In case of an error, returned is the -9999 value.

int charm_misc_arr_chck_symm(const double *arr, size_t size, double center, double eps, charm_err *err)¶

Checks whether a double arr array of size is symmetric with respect to center, that is, meets the following criteria:

1) arr[i] - center == center - arr[size - 1 - i] for i = 0, 1, ..., floor(size / 2) (up to some numerical threshold eps),

2) if size is odd, the middle element of arr is equal to center (within some numerical threshold eps).

Error reported by the function (if any) is written to err.

Returns

0 if all conditions are met; otherwise, returned is the number of condition that is not satisfied. In case of an error, returned is the -9999 value.
